div.h2: Need Help? Here are some popular links!

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: The Raytown School District is closely monitoring information regarding the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update

a.span: Southland CAPS Students Place in State Aspiring Educators Competition

div.p: Southland Center for Advanced Professional Studies (Southland CAPS) Education Exploration students earned top honors at the Missouri Educators Rising Competition in Columbia, MO on March 4 and qualified for the national competition in Washington D.C., in June.

a.title: Go to comments for Southland CAPS Students Place in State Aspiring Educators Competition

a.span: Herndon Career Center Director and Counselor Receive GKCSCA Honors

div.p: Herndon Career Center Director Dr. Cheryl Reichert was selected as the Greater Kansas City School Counselor Association’s (GKCSCA) Administrator of the Year and Herndon Career Center counselor Nate Zier was selected as the GKCSCA Counselor of the Year.

a.title: Go to comments for Herndon Career Center Director and Counselor Receive GKCSCA Honors

a.span: High School Dance Teams Place in State Competition

div.p: The Raytown High School Jaywalkers and Raytown South High School Cardettes both earned top honors in the Missouri State Dance Team Association’s State Competition, Feb. 29 at the HyVee Arena in Kansas City, MO.

a.title: Go to comments for High School Dance Teams Place in State Competition
Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program (MOCAP)

span.p: Policy IGCD: Eligible students may enroll in virtual courses offered through the Missouri Course Access Program (MOCAP). The district will accept all grades and credits earned through district-sponsored virtual instruction and MOCAP. The district will pay the costs of a virtual course only if the district has first approved the student's enrollment in the course as described in policy IGCD. Click the Image below for more information.
Enrollment period: Enrollment requests will be considered within the first fifteen days of the semester.

a.title: Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program (MOCAP)

img.title: Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program (MOCAP)
img.alt: Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program (MOCAP)

img.alt: Photo of a laptop with enroll now on it

p.span: Pre-Kindergarten (Pre-K) and Kindergarten enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is currently open.
All Families (new, returning, and Form 2) can enroll online and submit required documents via email to
. New and Form 2 families will receive an email with dates in July and August to visit the Enrollment Center in person to validate documents sent via email.
For more information about Residency and Enrollment, please click

a.title: Go to comments for Pre-K/Kindergarten Enrollment

span.p: We recognize that creating a safe learning environment is a critical part of helping each child achieve academic success. Sprigeo is an online system that parents, guardians, and students can use to report bullying incidents and school safety threats. Sprigeo gives our stakeholders another medium for communicating with our school administration when bullying or school safety incidents occur. All information sent through the Sprigeo system goes directly to school administrators through a secure online connection. For more information about Sprigeo, please click here. Para obtener más información sobre Sprigeo, haga clic aquí. Links are now live under the PARENTS and STUDENTS tabs at the top right of the district homepage or to submit a tip, please click here.

div.div: It is the policy of the Raytown C-2 School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law in its programs or employment practices as required by federal and state law.
